Description: Woman's dress made of black cotton sateen with round neckline and front opening. Embroidered in purple, yellow and green cotton thread across sleeves, down sides, around plastron and hem at front and back. Plastron further decorated with pierced metal discs and imitation coins, stamped with the date 1223. Lower edge of plastron has purple cotton fringe. Hem is oversewn with cross stitch and lined with patterned cotton cloth on inside to reinforce. Two vertical nursing slits at breast level. Folded horizontal line across lower half of dress indicates where it has been altered for shorter wearer.
Condition: Fair; cotton embroidery threads faded, cotton sateen stained in places.
Acquisition notes: Af1994,01.1 to 4 were purchased from J Stuart Ackary, and were descibed as "a small collection, mainly from Bahriyah Oasis in the Western Desert (Sahara) of Egypt, including an embroidered dress and other items of female personal adornment."
